criteria.vibe: Real coaching content, not sponsored by major US brands
criteria.contentType: Skills, drills, player development, parent engagement

prospects.name: Joey Wright
prospects.role: Director of Coaching - Transition Sports Adelaide, Owner - Shoothq
prospects.vibe: Professional coach with own training business. Posts skills content, coaching insights.
prospects.whyGoodFit: Local Adelaide coach with established training business. 5K followers = engaged micro-audience. Already runs coaching business (Shoothq) — CourtLab could be tool for his clients.
prospects.reachoutAngle: CourtLab as client management tool — track his trainees' progress, provide verified reports to parents.

prospects.name: Jarrod Clarke
prospects.role: Head Coach, SA Metro U18 Men, South Adelaide Basketball Club
prospects.vibe: Elite-level coach, not focused on Instagram growth. Posts personal/team content.
prospects.whyGoodFit: Low followers but high credibility — SA Metro coach. Different angle: not influencer partnership, but B2B club partnership through him.
prospects.reachoutAngle: Via South Adelaide Basketball Club connection. Position as club-wide tool.

prospects.name: Ian Morris
prospects.role: Skills & Performance Coach, 1 on 1 Training & Player Development
prospects.vibe: Sydney-based skills trainer. Active poster (1,182 posts). Focus on individual development.
prospects.whyGoodFit: Independent skills coach in Sydney. CourtLab could differentiate his training offering. 1.6K followers = perfect micro-influencer size.
prospects.reachoutAngle: CourtLab as competitive advantage — 'track every session, prove improvement to parents.'

prospects.name: Nay Sakya
prospects.vibe: Elite trainer, large following. High production value content.
prospects.sponsoredByMajorBrand: Possibly (check for Under Armour, Nike tags)
prospects.whyGoodFit: Australian-based elite trainer. Massive reach. Even if partially sponsored, CourtLab could be 'tool he uses' angle.
prospects.reachoutAngle: CourtLab for his academy students — track development between his sessions.

prospects.name: Dodo Elyazar
prospects.vibe: Camps and clinics across Australia. Running tour Jan 2026.
prospects.whyGoodFit: Perfect alignment — U12-U18 focus, camps, Australian tour. Massive opportunity for partnership.
prospects.reachoutAngle: CourtLab as camp combine partner — every kid gets verified assessment.

outreachTemplate.subject: Quick question about your coaching setup
outreachTemplate.body:
Hi {{name}},

I've been following your content on {{platform}} — your approach to {{specificTopic}} really resonates with what I'm building.

I'm Michael, founder of CourtLab. I'm an Adelaide-based basketball dad/coach who built a stat tracking and video tool because I got tired of glitchy apps that didn't work for local clubs.

I'd love to get your take on it. CourtLab helps:
- Track shooting %, vertical, speed with verified data (not AI guesswork)
- Create video playbooks for coaches
- Build hyper-local leaderboards

If it's not a fit for your setup, no worries — just thought someone with your focus on {{audience}} would have valuable perspective.

Happy to share a free Pro account either way.

Michael
courtlab.app
